intro: Paraprenanthes luchunensis, commonly known as the Lüchun paraprenanthes, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are compound, with a pinnate arrangement, and it produces small white or greenish flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
